title: Baby Shower
description: After planning an office baby shower for Jan, Michael is upset when he finds out that she had the baby without him--even though he's already been told that he's not the baby's father.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [looking pregnant] Hey Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Contractions are coming every ten minutes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, just remember to keep breathing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My cervix is ripening.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [drawing two family trees on a whiteboard] Jan is about to have a baby with a sperm donor. And Michael is preparing for the birth of a watermelon with Dwight.  Now, this baby will be related to Michael through [draws a question mark] delusion.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael! My water's breaking!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, OK! OK!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aaaaaaaa! What do you do? What do you do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I get a call from Jan and I meet her at the hospital.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right. Highways or surface roads?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I take Quincy Ave to Gibson.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, Gibson is covered in potholes.  Your car breaks down. Adapt!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I checked the route - there are no potholes.  Come on, get in here and have the baby.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's about adapting to the circumstances.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [annoyed] Andy, would you like to have my baby?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes! Yeah.  [squatting and pushing] Aaaaaaaa! Aaaaaaaa! Aaaaaaaa!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. OK, no.  I'm crowning!  I'm crowning!  Aaaaaaaa! [runs into Michael's office]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, OK. [to Andy] Sorry.  Sorry.  Here we go.  Here we go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The pressure!  The pressure!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do it! Do it!  Scream!  Scream it out, scream it out, scream it out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aaaaaaaa!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aaaaaaaa!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Babies are one of my many areas of expertise.  Growing up, I performed my own circumcision.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just keep pushing...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [lying on Michael's desk] Hold me!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm right here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cradle my head!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm right here, I'm right here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm screaming, I'm screaming, I'm screaming! Aaaaaaaa!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [annoyed] All right.  Dwight.  Just push and breathe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Numb me up. I want anesthesia!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shhh. No, you can't have it.  It's too late.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No! I don't want natural!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.  You have to just push it out!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Keep simulating.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aaaaaaaa!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you have the Sharpie?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Keep simulating.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you have the Sharpie?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I do!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK!  When the baby emerges, mark it secretly in a kind of a mark that only you could recognize and no baby snatcher can ever copy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ready?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aaaaaaaa!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aaaaaaaa!  It's coming!  Here we go! [drops the watermelon onto the floor] Oh! God! Wow! What was on that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Butter. Newborns are slippery.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice touch.  Good.  Let's try that again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [eating the watermelon] It is going to be the happiest day of my life. [Dwight gets dressed behind Michael and zips his fly]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello ladies, how's my shower going?  Phyllis, did you get the live storks?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Damnit, Phyllis!  I'm sorry.  [more softly] Damnit, Phyllis.  It was hard enough to convince Jan to come.  So are we set for refreshments?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Per your instructions, we have the personalized M&Ms with the baby names.  This is your boy bowl, with the name "Chevy." And this is the girl bowl, with M&Ms with the name "Astird."

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That can't be right.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Michael wrote down "Astird."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She said it is the name of a Viking princess. So...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Ass...turd.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.  I know.  It is beautiful.  No.  Thank you.  Is this it? I mean, is this... Two bowls of M&Ms and some balloons?  You know what Phyllis, I think you need to step it up.  I think you need to get the lead out.  Because if I'm not mistaken, we gave you your wedding shower here.  We all came into this room and gave you a golden shower.  Well you know what, where's my golden shower, Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It does not matter to me at all whether this baby is biologically mine.  I am going to love it. It's like when the dog nurses the tiger cub.  Have you seen that video?  It is... it's so bizarre and unnatural, but... it, it happens.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hey, I'm collecting for the baby shower.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: But Phyllis, it's not his baby.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I know, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why do we have to pay money to get a gift for his ex-girlfriend's unborn sperm bank baby?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Look at it as if you're paying for the cake, not the baby.  Sheet cake.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I do enjoy being the head of the Party Planning Committee.  I'm no longer under Angela's heel, and her little grape head is under mine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [banging on the glass] Hey, hey.  What are you doing?  Don't talk to them.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Make the party.  Don't - make the party, please, Phyllis. [Phyllis starts inflating a balloon with a pump] Pump it!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] So you know Stacy, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right, the one from England.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There's no one from England, Jim.  Katie studied in Ireland - this is Stacy, the one who does the Murakami-style collages.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. Right, that style.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, Stacy and Eric get to Bogre's DeTech half an hour early so they don't have to sit on the slab.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Anyway, Bogre's TA Sarah Kaya comes in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, who's Sarah Kayacombsen?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, Sarah Kaya comes in.  Don't interrupt, I have like thirty seconds to finish this and get to DigiPres.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So Sarah Kaya says to Eric, "No way.  You can't reserve seats." And Stacy gets all up in her face and Sarah Kaya picks up Stacy's new PM pad and throws it at the light box.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [clearly just humoring her] No... way!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ha ha. That's hilarious?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, it's horrible!  Jim, she might get arrested.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who, Stacy?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, Stacy is a boy.  Ugh.  Frustrating.  Why can't you just be in art class with me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, wait, I gotta go, class starting. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, I'll ta...I'll talk to you later. [hangs up]  That was a good story.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who's Sarah Kayacombsen?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yo.  I got the Nard-puppy for ya.  What's going on here?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's a baby game where you guess whose picture is whose.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Awww.  Check it out - who would have thought that this little baby would be marrying that little baby?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That's Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well -

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah, it is.  So I hope you two are very happy together.  Pervert.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why would that make me a pervert, I -

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, it does.  That's me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's not you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes it is.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's mean, come on, that's - [Angela storms out]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahoy, matey.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Ahoy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahoy. So, how you doin'?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, listen.  Jan Levinson is coming in today, and she is in the terminal stages of her pregnancy - the child of which I have a vested interest.  It's all kind of weird.  Anyway, she is incredibly... fat and enormous right now - extremely unattractive.  And you are, on the other hand, one of the more attractive people in the office.  So, while she's here I am going to be acting kind of cold to you.  And I am doing this to pay respect to her bloated feelings.  And I'm treating Ryan the same way.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Of course. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I do not like pregnant women in my workspace.  They're always complaining.  I have varicose veins, too.  I have swollen ankles, I'm constantly hungry - do you think my nipples don't get sore too?  Do you think I don't need to know the fastest way to the hospital?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jan enters the office, pushing a stroller] Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hi, Jim!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What do we have here?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: This is my baby.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh no... [Michael enters and notices Jan's baby]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jan had the baby and Michael wasn't there to mark it.  So the baby could be anybody's.  Except Michael's.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So this is Astird.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Astrid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, OK.  Why didn't you call me?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, um, you know, labor just kind of started very suddenly and-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I could have helped.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And the birth instructor thought it wasn't a good idea for you to be there, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, man. Him? That guy? He had no sense of humor and I proved him wrong in so many ways.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: OK, you don't have any idea what I've been through, so, let's...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I don't!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I'm sorry, I thought today at the baby shower would be a good time for the two of you to meet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can I hold her?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yes, yes you can. You know, I think, just leave her in the car seat. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [cradling the car seat awkwardly] All right, OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I love babies. I think they are beautiful in all sorts of different ways.  I try to pick up and hold a baby every day, if possible, because it nourishes me.  It feeds my soul.  Babies are drawn to me, and I think it's because they see me as one of them.  But cooler, and with my life put together a little bit.  If a baby were president, there would be no taxes, there would be no war.  There would be no government, and things could get terrible.  It actually, probably - it would be a better screenplay idea than a serious suggestion.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [carrying the car seat] Ladies and gentlemen, it is my privilege and honor to present for the first time in her life and in the office:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ready to play some games? Let's do it!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, the baby's already been born.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, duh.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So we had games planned but the baby ruins all of them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, the baby doesn't ruin anything, Kevin, OK?  The baby multiplies the fun.  Let's just do what you were going to do.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: OK...  Who wants to guess when the baby will be born?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, how about some presents?  I want to see some presents. [holding a memo pad] I got this so I can write down for thank-you notes.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thank you.  That's very sweet of you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whatta we got?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Um, we all chipped in and got you this stroller.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She already has a stroller.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: And this is way worse than the stroller she came with.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: She's got an Orbit; that's a twelve hundred dollar stroller.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Huh. Twelve hundred dollars for a stroller? Phhhbt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, what else?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Twelve hundred dollars is what I spent on my whole bomb shelter.  For that kind of money, this stroller should be indestructible. [straps the watermelon into the stroller on the elevator]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [singing "Son of a Preacher Man" to Astrid] Being good isn't always easy / No matter how hard I try / When he started sweet-talking to me / He'd come and tell me everything is all right / He'd kiss and tell me everything is all right / Can I get away again tonight / The only one...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey!  You busy?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not even. I'm doing laundry for the first time in like a month.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, OK, so you gotta hear this.  So, Jan's shower is going on right now, and she's singing "Son of a Preacher Man" and everyone's just staring at her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can't hear anything, there's like, there's like machines going-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The song is about losing your virginity next to a church, and guess what - she's been singing for the last twenty minutes!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can't hear anything!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. OK, well you know what, I um, just call me later.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm not frustrated. Even if I were in Scranton, Jim and I would have days like this. We're just... a little out of sync.  You know, that's all.  Oh, great.  I washed my lipstick.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [now belting out the lyrics, even though Astrid is asleep] How well I remember / The look that was in his eyes / Stealing kisses from me on the sly / Taking time to make time / Telling me that he's all mine / Learning from each other's knowing / Looking to see how much we've grown / And the only one...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [heaving the stroller into a tire yard] Don't hit the fence.  Oh no, my child!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [throwing the stroller against a high chain link fence] Don't get stuck on the barbed wire!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [tossing the stroller off a tall heap of tires] Playtime is over!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So Jan, tell my intended about the miracle of childbirth.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, actually, I, uh, I had a tub birth.  And it was really, really quite amazing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You gave birth in a tub?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah, it's a really nice transition from womb to world, you know, kind of like a big womb.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Um, so you're in the tub with everything?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, the afterbirth floats, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Must be like the tide at Omaha Beach.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh no, it's actually really hygienic, Creed.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'm done.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Me too.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And after the birth you get out and deliver the afterbirth. [everyone starts leaving]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! Hey, no no no no no no no no. No.  No.  This is the birth story. It was beautiful. It was beautiful.  This is a once-in-a-lifetime experience.  And I should have been there. I should have been there to witness this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I could have helped.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You're sad about this.  I know that, and I wish that I...  but...  would it help if you held Astrid for just a, a little bit?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [smiling] Uh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: All right.  Um, I'm just going to lie down for a couple of minutes.  I'm exhausted, so um.  Remind me to talk to you about Astrid's 529.  Wake me in twenty.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [voiceover] I usually love babies, but when I held Astrid I just felt... shortchanged.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Phyllis?  Could you take-.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey guys.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What's up, Mike?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, I need some advice from one baby daddy to another.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You a baby daddy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I a baby daddy.  Um, when you first became a baby daddy, did you have an immediate connection with that baby?  Like, the first time that you held it, did you find that with your baby baby?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hell yeah.  You know why?  Because that was my baby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just saw this baby daddy-

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You should stop calling yourself "baby daddy."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why, Darryl, because I'm quote white quote unquote?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Because you're not a daddy, and it's not your baby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well-

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You feel connected to his baby over there?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's- that's different.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You feel connected to this? [hold up his back brace]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's not a baby.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You want to hold me, to see how you feel?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] Could I?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [wakes up on the reception couch] Oh. I was just catching up on my sleep.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I can imagine.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Where's Astrid?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, I think she's on a sales call.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: On a what?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Waaa! More paper! Waaa! [she cracks herself up but Jan is unimpressed]  No, she's just on a coffee break.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [sarcastically] That's funny.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: She's with Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [with Astrid covered in and surrounded by vegetables on a lunch table] That's good.  Now, I need you to - I need it to look up here.  Get the baby to look up here, ready?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK.  Yeah.  Look at my finger.  Look.  Looook!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Now. Come on, up here!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Look up here!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Your hand's in it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What? Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah, that's a good one.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What are you doing? What's going on? Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We're taking a picture.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [picking up Astrid] There you are.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: She's nature's bounty.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You don't flash around a newborn baby.  Don't you know that?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, I need your help.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sees Holly behind Jan] I was just going to...  I was going to talk to Holly, about her hygiene.  She smells like old tomatoes and dirt.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh... come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I like to call this... the bumper test. [drags the stroller behind his car and runs into it several times]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure you can't stay a little longer?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, no, Michael, you know what? I really have to go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.  All right, everybody, we're leaving.  Jan and Astrid are leaving.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know what, where is the stroller that I came in with?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.  I took the liberty of putting it in your trunk.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ah.  Thanks, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: OK.  You know what?  There is, uh, there is one more thing that you can do for me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Don't date Holly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wha - that's, I hate her.  Wha - God!  Why would you even ask me to - I, I mean, not that it matters, 'cause I don't, but wha - OK, all right, fine.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thanks for the baby shower.  It was great.  And I'll see you... soon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You still gonna be mean to me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [just hugs her, and she hugs him back and smiles] You wanna go out?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn't feel much when I held Astrid, but I got a good feeling from Holly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on voicemail] Hey, it's Jim.  Leave a message.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on voicemail, because she's calling Jim at the same time] Hi, this is Pam.  Leave a message.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [walking to his car] Hey, it's me.  It is 5:03.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I figured I'd catch you walking to your car, but...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You must be out or something.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'll leave a message.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is it me, or are we just a little off today?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I guess this is just one of those days.  It'll get better.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hope you didn't have any major laundry issues.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I finished my laundry.  Got all my socks.  Nothing like that time that crazy guy pushed you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Remember that time that I helped you do your laundry and that crazy guy came in and started yelling at you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And then, remember, we went shopping the next day to buy me a washer and dryer?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yet here you are, back in a Laundromat.  Now, I'm just trying to help you, Beesly.  Be safe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're probably upset that I'm even at a Laundromat right now.  But, don't worry, I'm being safe.  And I'm headed home.  I'm... headed to my dorm.  Not home.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wish you were home.  Uh, anyway...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Anyway, um... I miss you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I miss you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: All right, how about we play the game where we guess how big the mother's belly is?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! OK!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: How many squares of toilet paper go around the waist?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Does that mean there's no toilet paper in the bathroom?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin, relax.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: OK, you know what, I don't think I need to do this one, because I only gained twelve pounds and I'm just going to get rid of all of that, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Seventeen.  I say seventeen squares.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: OK, give me the roll.  I'll do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do the boobs!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah, we're not doing my boobs, Michael.  OK, seven, someone give me the prize.  [to Astrid] Oh, it's OK...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Did she really just have a baby? She's so beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah.  Wait 'til you get to know her better though.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! HR lady, stop whispering in the corner please.  Very rude.  You're ruining the party.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I'm starting to get a feeling for what life was like around here for Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [on the phone] It was terrible.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I prefer being stuck in a Costa Rican hospital.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Not really.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey Jan, you went to a sperm bank?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh, yes, I did.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I donated sperm.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Maybe I'm the father.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, this is a highly exclusive establishment.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Next to the IHOP?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, I paid for an ideal specimen.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Are you saying Kevin is not an ideal specimen?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: This is a wonderful shower, everyone.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to camera] I might have done it with Jan!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It's not Kevin's child.  Can't possibly be.  I mean, I don't know what I would do.  Sue... icide?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [Jan nurses Astrid with her top down, office workers try to work] Okay, 'Stridly, you want to try the other side?  Okay, here we go.  That's good.  Oh, good job.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Jan?  What's new?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know what, Kevin?  Why don't you just go ahead and stare?  Because, you know, it's, it's fine with me.  I mean, this is sooo natural, and so beautiful, and...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Seriously?  You're okay with that?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Of course.  I mean, there's nothing erotic about this, you know, it's, it's, it's what these [shakes a breast] were made for, you know, I mean they're full of baby milk, they're... nourishing my baby, so... [tosses head proudly, Creed comes up to stand next to Kevin, staring directly at Jan's chest]  Michael!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello, spoiled little baby, [to a watermelon] in your fancy brand name stroller.  Mmm, I wonder if it's as safe as they say it is.  Oh, look, a curb.  Uh oh, let's see what happens... [lets it go, it flies off the curb, stays upright, and stops safely] Inconclusive. [pushes it out into the street, it rolls to a stop] Spartans would leave a weak baby by the side of the road.  My parents left me beside the road.  I crawled home.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not so weak, huh, Mom?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gosh, Mommy feels like taking a jog. [runs with stroller]  Oh, no!  Mommy forgot to wear a bra, and her big fake boobs are really hurting her, and she needs to let go, she can't control the stroller any longer [forcefully pushes stroller away toward uneven ground with junk strewn around, the stroller hits some junk, stays upright, and stops safely]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's see what this baby can do... [drives car fast, holding stroller alongside the car, stroller remains fine] Aaaah!  Aa-aaah! [throws it ahead of the car, it goes for a while and then is stopping]  It's a hardy stroller. [takes watermelon out of stroller, holds it up to show camera] Maybe it's safe!
